Methods

AddConnectionToGroup(String, String, RequestContext)

Add a connection to the target group.

Declaration
public virtual Azure.Response AddConnectionToGroup (string group, string connectionId, Azure.RequestContext context = default);
Parameters
System.String group

Target group name, which length should be greater than 0 and less than 1025.
System.String connectionId

Target connection Id.
Azure.RequestContext context

The request context, which can override default behaviors of the client pipeline on a per-call basis.
Returns
Azure.Response

The response returned from the service.
Remarks

Schema for Response Error:

{
  code: string,
  message: string,
  target: string,
  details: [ErrorDetail],
  inner: {
    code: string,
    inner: InnerError
  }
}
Examples

This sample shows how to call AddConnectionToGroup with required parameters.


var client = new WebPubSubServiceClient("<https://my-account-name.azure.com>", "<hub>");

Response response = client.AddConnectionToGroup("<group>", "<connectionId>");
Console.WriteLine(response.Status);
Exceptions
System.ArgumentNullException

group or connectionId is null.
System.ArgumentException

group or connectionId is an empty string, and was expected to be non-empty.
Azure.RequestFailedException

Service returned a non-success status code.

CheckPermission(WebPubSubPermission, String, String, RequestContext)

Check if a connection has permission to the specified action.

Declaration
public virtual Azure.Response<bool> CheckPermission (Azure.Messaging.WebPubSub.WebPubSubPermission permission, string connectionId, string targetName = default, Azure.RequestContext context = default);
Parameters
WebPubSubPermission permission

The permission: current supported actions are joinLeaveGroup and sendToGroup.
System.String connectionId

Target connection Id.
System.String targetName

Optional. If not set, get the permission for all targets. If set, get the permission for the specific target. The meaning of the target depends on the specific permission.
Azure.RequestContext context

Options specifying the cancellation token, controlling error reporting, etc.
Returns
Azure.Response<System.Boolean>

CheckPermissionAsync(WebPubSubPermission, String, String, RequestContext)

Check if a connection has permission to the specified action.

Declaration
[[System.Diagnostics.DebuggerStepThrough]]
public virtual System.Threading.Tasks.Task<Azure.Response<bool>> CheckPermissionAsync (Azure.Messaging.WebPubSub.WebPubSubPermission permission, string connectionId, string targetName = default, Azure.RequestContext context = default);
Parameters
WebPubSubPermission permission

The permission: current supported actions are joinLeaveGroup and sendToGroup.
System.String connectionId

Target connection Id.
System.String targetName

Optional. If not set, get the permission for all targets. If set, get the permission for the specific target. The meaning of the target depends on the specific permission.
Azure.RequestContext context

Options specifying the cancellation token, controlling error reporting, etc.
Returns
System.Threading.Tasks.Task<Azure.Response<System.Boolean>>

CloseAllConnections(IEnumerable<String>, String, RequestContext)

Close the connections in the hub.

Declaration
public virtual Azure.Response CloseAllConnections (System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable<string> excluded = default, string reason = default, Azure.RequestContext context = default);
Parameters
System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable<System.String> excluded

Exclude these connectionIds when closing the connections in the hub.
System.String reason

The reason closing the client connection.
Azure.RequestContext context

The request context, which can override default behaviors of the client pipeline on a per-call basis.
Returns
Azure.Response

The response returned from the service.
Remarks

Schema for Response Error:

{
  code: string,
  message: string,
  target: string,
  details: [ErrorDetail],
  inner: {
    code: string,
    inner: InnerError
  }
}
Examples

This sample shows how to call CloseAllConnections.


var client = new WebPubSubServiceClient("<https://my-account-name.azure.com>", "<hub>");

Response response = client.CloseAllConnections();
Console.WriteLine(response.Status);

This sample shows how to call CloseAllConnections with all parameters.


var client = new WebPubSubServiceClient("<https://my-account-name.azure.com>", "<hub>");

Response response = client.CloseAllConnections(new String[]{"<excluded>"}, "<reason>");
Console.WriteLine(response.Status);
Exceptions
Azure.RequestFailedException

Service returned a non-success status code.

GrantPermission(WebPubSubPermission, String, String, RequestContext)

Grant permission to the connection.

Declaration
public virtual Azure.Response GrantPermission (Azure.Messaging.WebPubSub.WebPubSubPermission permission, string connectionId, string targetName = default, Azure.RequestContext context = default);
Parameters
WebPubSubPermission permission

The permission: current supported actions are joinLeaveGroup and sendToGroup.
System.String connectionId

Target connection Id.
System.String targetName

Optional. If not set, grant the permission to all the targets. If set, grant the permission to the specific target. The meaning of the target depends on the specific permission.
Azure.RequestContext context

Options specifying the cancellation token, controlling error reporting, etc.
Returns
Azure.Response

This sample shows how to call RemoveConnectionFromGroup with required parameters.

Console.WriteLine(response.Status);
Exceptions
System.ArgumentNullException

group or connectionId is null.
System.ArgumentException

group or connectionId is an empty string, and was expected to be non-empty.
Azure.RequestFailedException

Service returned a non-success status code.

RevokePermission(WebPubSubPermission, String, String, RequestContext)

Revoke permission for the connection.

Declaration
public virtual Azure.Response RevokePermission (Azure.Messaging.WebPubSub.WebPubSubPermission permission, string connectionId, string targetName = default, Azure.RequestContext context = default);
Parameters
WebPubSubPermission permission

The permission: current supported actions are joinLeaveGroup and sendToGroup.
System.String connectionId

Target connection Id.
System.String targetName

Optional. If not set, revoke the permission for all targets. If set, revoke the permission for the specific target. The meaning of the target depends on the specific permission.
Azure.RequestContext context

Options specifying the cancellation token, controlling error reporting, etc.
Returns
Azure.Response

RevokePermissionAsync(WebPubSubPermission, String, String, RequestContext)

Revoke permission for the connection.

Declaration
[[System.Diagnostics.DebuggerStepThrough]]
public virtual System.Threading.Tasks.Task<Azure.Response> RevokePermissionAsync (Azure.Messaging.WebPubSub.WebPubSubPermission permission, string connectionId, string targetName = default, Azure.RequestContext context = default);
Parameters
WebPubSubPermission permission

The permission: current supported actions are joinLeaveGroup and sendToGroup.
System.String connectionId

Target connection Id.
System.String targetName

Optional. If not set, revoke the permission for all targets. If set, revoke the permission for the specific target. The meaning of the target depends on the specific permission.
Azure.RequestContext context

Options specifying the cancellation token, controlling error reporting, etc.
Returns
System.Threading.Tasks.Task<Azure.Response>

SendToAll(String, ContentType)

Broadcast message to all the connected client connections.

Declaration
public virtual Azure.Response SendToAll (string content, Azure.Core.ContentType contentType = default);
Parameters
System.String content

Azure.Core.ContentType contentType

Defaults to ContentType.PlainText.
Returns
Azure.Response

A Azure.Response if successful.

SendToAll(RequestContent, ContentType, IEnumerable<String>, RequestContext)

Broadcast content inside request body to all the connected client connections.

Declaration
public virtual Azure.Response SendToAll (Azure.Core.RequestContent content, Azure.Core.ContentType contentType, System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable<string> excluded = default, Azure.RequestContext context = default);
Parameters
Azure.Core.RequestContent content

The content to send as the body of the request. Details of the request body schema are in the Remarks section below.
Azure.Core.ContentType contentType

Upload file type. Allowed values: "application/json" | "application/octet-stream" | "text/plain".
System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable<System.String> excluded

Excluded connection Ids.
Azure.RequestContext context

The request context, which can override default behaviors of the client pipeline on a per-call basis.
Returns
Azure.Response

The response returned from the service.
Remarks

Schema for Response Error:

{
  code: string,
  message: string,
  target: string,
  details: [ErrorDetail],
  inner: {
    code: string,
    inner: InnerError
  }
}
Examples

This sample shows how to call SendToAll with required parameters and request content.


var client = new WebPubSubServiceClient("<https://my-account-name.azure.com>", "<hub>");

var data = File.OpenRead("<binary.data>");

Response response = client.SendToAll(RequestContent.Create(data), ContentType.ApplicationOctetStream);
Console.WriteLine(response.Status);

This sample shows how to call SendToAll with all parameters and request content.


var client = new WebPubSubServiceClient("<https://my-account-name.azure.com>", "<hub>");

var data = File.OpenRead("<binary.data>");

Response response = client.SendToAll(RequestContent.Create(data), ContentType.ApplicationOctetStream, new String[]{"<excluded>"});
Console.WriteLine(response.Status);
Exceptions
System.ArgumentNullException

content is null.
Azure.RequestFailedException

Service returned a non-success status code.
